blurb: Police respond to posters at Marie Mount and Tydings halls that advertised white nationalist group American Vanguard. "Defending your people is a social duty," one of the posters reads. Over the coming months, similar posters are reported at least five more times.
name: White nationalist posters found on campus buildings

blurb: A noose is found hanging in the kitchen of the Phi Kappa Tau fraternity house. Police determined the event was a hate bias incident, but the investigation ultimately bore no results. The event was the spark for renewed activism from marginalized student groups — culminating in a march on the administration building.

headline.text: Noose found in UMD Phi Kappa Tau chapter house kitchen

name: Noose found in fraternity house

blurb: 2nd Lt. Richard Collins is stabbed while waiting for an Uber with two friends near the Montgomery Hall bus stop. Days away from graduating, the Bowie State University student dies on his way to the hospital.

headline.text: UMD student charged in connection with stabbing near Montgomery Hall

name: Richard Collins killed

blurb: The admissions department receives letters from a handful of black students who had been admitted to the university but had chosen not to enroll, specifically citing safety concerns in the wake of Collins’ death.

headline.text: Black students send letters to admissions department

name: Black students send letters to admissions department

blurb: University President Wallace Loh announces the creation of a Joint Task Force on Inclusion and Respect, aimed at reviewing campus policies and making recommendations to the administration in the hopes of improving the campus for minority students. He also announces "plans to consider harsher punishments for hate bias incidents."

headline.text: Loh announces diversity task force chairs, new initiatives to "stand for our values"

name: Loh announces diversity task force

blurb: Loh announces that the university will construct a memorial to Collins and that Neijma Celestine-Donnor will fill the role of hate bias response coordinator, meaning she'll work to develop education and outreach efforts to combat hate on the campus.

headline.text: Loh announces diversity task force chairs, new initiatives to "stand for our values"

name: Collins memorial, hate bias response coordinator announced

blurb: Loh signs off on the joint task force's recommendations, which include a policy prohibiting “threatening or intimidating acts motivated in whole or in part because of an individual or group’s actual or perceived protected status,” and a statement affirming the university's values.
name: Loh signs off on task force recommendations

blurb: Roger Worthington, who served in the chief diversity officer role for just over a year, resigns from his position. He later criticizes the administration for not allowing him to speak honestly with the campus community during his time on the job.
name: Interim chief diversity officer resigns

blurb: The university releases its fall 2018 enrollment data, showing the lowest enrollment of black freshmen since 1992 — the first year data was collected. Just over 7 percent of the freshman class was African-American, a 30 percent decrease from the previous year.
name: Data shows sharp decline in black enrollment

blurb: The release of the long-awaited external review of diversity on the campus, commissioned after Collins’ death, offers few answers and largely endorses the efforts the administration has already taken.
name: External review offers few answers

blurb: The university announced its hiring of Georgina Dodge, formerly the current chief diversity officer at Bucknell University, as the new Vice President of Diversity and Inclusion. She tells The Diamondback she’ll make it a priority to rebuild trust between students and the administration.
name: Vice President of Diversity and Inclusion hired

blurb: The full results of the campus climate survey — launched in January 2018 — reveal that safety concerns and feelings of detachment at the university are disproportionately high among minority groups. White respondents reported feeling the most safe, while black and African American respondents reported feeling the least safe.
name: Climate survey data finds safety concerns among minorities

blurb: At a town hall held to honor Collins' life and discuss hate at UMD, students called for the demolition of the bus stop where the young man was killed and the construction of a memorial in its place. They also expressed frustration that these steps hadn't already been taken.
name: Students call for a Collins memorial 2 years after his killing
